overview_of_class: This course is focused on fluency and comprehensibility in conversation in both informal and academic settings. It is designed to help students develop and refine their English conversation, discussion, and discourse skills. While some attention will be given to American English intonation, word stress, and pronunciation, the primary purpose of this class is to explore functions of American English important for fluency in conversational speech. This will help improve your performance on tasks and activities involving spoken English, such as oral proficiency exams, presentations, teaching, and day-to-day social interactions.
name: Spoken English for Non-Native Speakers
subject: LING

overview_of_class: The primary goal of this course is to improve students' ability to effectively communicate in American English both inside and outside of the classroom.  Our focus will be on intelligibility (pronunciation and fluency), and the linguistic and practical skills that underlie successful communication.  In order to attain this goal, we will devote class time to practicing the skills required for English proficiency tests like the Versant test, such as effective listening, reading aloud, answering short questions, and paraphrasing stories.  We will also devote class time to developing the skills students use in academic environments, such as making presentations, reporting on written information, leading and participating in discussions, and agreeing/disagreeing.  Students will be encouraged to put these skills to use in their other classes, as well as interactions outside of the classroom.
name: Spoken English for Non-Native Speakers
subject: LING
